resources.string: Here you can see the progress of the update. And how you can help us.

The attacker leverages weaknesses in the WPS implementation, particularly in routers made by certain chip makers like Ralink, Realtek, and Broadcom. This approach allows the attacker to recover the WPS PIN and the Pre-Shared Keys (PSKs) associated with the network in a relatively short amount of time. This is significantly faster than a traditional brute force attack, which could take hours. Once the attacker has obtained the WPS PIN, they can gain access to the network and potentially to the passwords on wireless routers, thereby compromising network security

\nA specific type of WPS PIN attack targets wireless routers by checking a limited set of PINs, often around 30, which are determined based on the network\'s BSSID (Basic Service Set Identifier). This attack method is more sophisticated than a standard brute-force approach, as it relies on the correlation between the router\'s BSSID and known vulnerable WPS PINs.

This attack exploits a vulnerability in the WPS protocol, where the first four digits and the last four digits of the 8-digit PIN are validated separately. This reduces the number of attempts needed to guess the correct PIN significantly. Once the correct PIN is found, the attacker can connect to the network and potentially access sensitive information
This attack will try to connect to the network using a custom pin. You can set the pin before the attack

A password brute force attack involves systematically attempting every possible combination of characters until the correct password is found. This method relies on trial and error and can be time-consuming, especially for complex passwords with a mix of characters, numbers, and symbols. The effectiveness of such attacks diminishes significantly with longer and more complex passwords

A handshake capture attack targets the initial communication between a device and a network. The attacker captures the \"handshake,\" which includes cryptographic data used to establish a secure connection. This data is then analyzed offline to crack the network\'s password, often exploiting weak passwords or vulnerabilities in the handshake protocol. It\'s commonly used against Wi-Fi networks with WPA/WPA2 security

A deauthentication (deauth) attack disrupts network communications by sending deauthentication frames from an attacker to a device, making it appear as if they come from the network. This forces the device to disconnect and re-authenticate. The attack is often used to capture the handshake in WPA/WPA2 secured networks or to create a denial-of-service condition. It\'s a common tactic in wireless network hacking due to its simplicity and effectiveness in temporarily disconnecting devices from a network

Due android policy, this app requires root permissions
